availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Harriet Bogard Bayles. Father of Virginia Bayles, Isabella Bayles, William M. Licungus Bayles, Thomas Bayles, David Bayles, Richard Bayles, Theophilus Bayles, Augustus Bayles, Columbus Bayles, Alfa Ann Bayles, William E. Bayles, and Nancy Walta Bayles. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 2, p. 378A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 2, p. 151.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 530.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Spring Hill, p. 490B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994039, Hickman County Births.
